conventicius: <entryFree id="n10978" type="main" key="conventi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>convenio</etym>, <sense id="n10978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to coming together</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">intercourse</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10978.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres conventicii,</quote> <trans><tr>coming from various quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10978.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conventī-cĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. aes), = <foreign lang="greek">to\ e)kklhsiastiko/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">money paid to the poorer Greek citizens for attendance in the assemblies of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conventiculum: <entryFree id="n10979" type="main" key="conventi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>conventus</etym> (rare). <sense id="n10979.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assembly, meeting, association</hi>: conventicula hominum, quae postea<cb n="CONV" />  civitates nominatae sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebei urbanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:28:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 28, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10979.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place of assembly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus Christiani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conventio: <entryFree id="n10980" type="main" key="conventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convenio</etym>, <sense id="n10980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting, assembling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10980.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare), Cod. Th. 8, 8, 3; 16, 2, 14 al.—</sense><sense id="n10980.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10980.3" n="A" level="2"> = contio, <hi rend="ital">an assembly, meeting</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=87 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 87 sq.</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113, 10</bibl>: in conventione = in contione.—</sense><sense id="n10980.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Agreement, covenant, convention, compact</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:70 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 70 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10980.5" n="C" level="2"> In manum conventio, of a woman, <hi rend="ital">the coming into the hands</hi> (manus) <hi rend="ital">of her husband by marriage</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 26, 7</bibl>; cf. convenio, I. B. 2.—</sense><sense id="n10980.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A judicial proceeding against one, indictment, charge</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">personae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 6, 3 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
conventionalis: <entryFree id="n10981" type="main" key="conventi^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conventio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an agreement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compact, conventional</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:5:section=52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 5, § 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conventitius: <entryFree id="n10982" type="main" key="conventi_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventītĭus</orth>, v. conventicius.</entryFree>
conventiuncula: <entryFree id="n10983" type="hapax" key="conventi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>conventio, I.</etym>, <sense id="n10983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small assembly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 56" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
convento: <entryFree id="n10984" type="hapax" key="convento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convento</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [convenio], <hi rend="ital">to meet often</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conventum: <entryFree id="n10985" type="main" key="conventum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>convenio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 2.</entryFree>
conventus: <entryFree id="n10986" type="main" key="conventus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of convenio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10987" type="main" key="conventus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (CONVENTVVS, C. I. L. II. p. 2416), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>convenio</etym>. <sense id="n10987.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to convenio, I.) <hi rend="ital">A meeting;</hi> in concr., <hi rend="ital">an assembly</hi> (syn: coetus, contio, corona). </sense><sense id="n10987.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n10987.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (for social intercourse, counsel, religious celebration, discussion, instruction. etc.; very freq., and class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">comitum, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 27: celeberrimo virorum mulierumque conventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cai. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures minime digni elegantis conventus auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudentissimas feminas in tantum virorum conventum prodire cogis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 753</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 23</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n10987.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10987.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Persons associated in a provincial town for the sake of trade, a company, corporation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 32</bibl> Zumpt; 2, 5, 36, § 94; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 40 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10987.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A judicial assembly, court of justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere conventum,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold a court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 44</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventibus peractis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10987.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate objects, <hi rend="ital">a union, conjunction</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">duarum stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10987.7" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to convenio, II.) <hi rend="ital">A union, connection</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10987.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of atoms, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 612</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for coition: ex conventu Jovis inseminati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10987.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a compact, agreement, covenant</hi> (for the usu. conventum): <cit><quote lang="la">ex conventu,</quote> <trans><tr>by agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl> (where B. and K. read ex convento).</sense></entryFree>
convenusto: <entryFree id="n10988" type="main" key="conve^nusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĕnusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to ornament, adorn</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesiam cultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: Aurora primo convenustans habitu fenestras, Mart. Cap. poët. 2, § 219 al.</sense></entryFree>
converbero: <entryFree id="n10989" type="main" key="converbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-verbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to strike severely, to beat, bruise</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10989.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10989.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <trans><tr>to chastise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Ira, 3, 20, 1.</sense></entryFree>
convergo: <entryFree id="n10990" type="main" key="convergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to incline together</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">punctus quo cuncta convergunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
converritor: <entryFree id="n10991" type="hapax" key="converri^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">converrĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>converro</etym>, <sense id="n10991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sweeps together</hi>, Cat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
converro: <entryFree id="n10992" type="main" key="converro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-verro</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vorro</orth>), <itype>verri, versum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to sweep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brush together, to sweep, clear away</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10992.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc egomet, tu hoc convorre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiam scopas atque hoc convorram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; 2, 2, 64; Publ. Syr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 900</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina templorum osculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 36 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n10992.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: hereditates omnium, <hi rend="ital">to scrape</hi> <pb n="464" /> <cb n="CONV" /> <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 78</bibl> (al. convertere). —Humorously: aliquem totum cum pulvisculo, <hi rend="ital">to sweep thoroughly, to beat the dust out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to beat soundly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conversatio: <entryFree id="n10993" type="main" key="conversa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>converso</etym> (not ante-Aug.). * <sense id="n10993.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Frequent use</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. Cod. Th. 11, 21, 1 al.—</sense><sense id="n10993.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Frequent abode in a place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:12:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 12, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10993.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Intercourse, conversation</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">licentiosior cum viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Contr. 6:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Contr. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 102, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conversator: <entryFree id="n10994" type="gloss" key="conversa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversātor</orth>, <sense id="n10994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o(modi/aitos</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
conversibilis: <entryFree id="n10995" type="main" key="conversi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversĭbĭlis</orth>, v. convertibilis.</entryFree>
conversim: <entryFree id="n10996" type="main" key="conversim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>converto</etym>, <sense id="n10996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conversely</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 491</bibl>; Firm. Math. 2, 32.</sense></entryFree>
conversio: <entryFree id="n10997" type="main" key="conversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning round, revolving, revolution</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n10997.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10997.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrorum omnesque motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10997.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The periodical return of the seasons, caused by the revolution of the heavenly bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensium annorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10997.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in medic. lang., </sense><sense id="n10997.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A turning round, inverting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 23, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10997.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An abscess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10997.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10997.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">subversion, alteration, change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversio et perturbatio rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio et conversio tempestatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 13, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10997.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhet., </sense><sense id="n10997.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The change</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transfer from one species of composition to another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10997.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The repetition of the same word at the end of a clause</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)ntistrofh/</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">e)pifora/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 13, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10997.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The rounding of a period</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kamph/, sustrofh/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim has orationis conversiones Graeci nominant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (oratio) conversiones habeat absolutas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10997.13" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A moral change, conversion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 6, 49</bibl>; esp. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad verum Deum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 33: ad unum verum Deum sanctumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10997.14" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A change of view</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta conversio consecuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conversiuncula: <entryFree id="n10998" type="main" key="conversi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conversio</etym>, <sense id="n10998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight change</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Ep. 4, p. 320</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
converso: <entryFree id="n10999" type="main" key="converso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-verso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n10999.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to turn round</hi>: animus se ipse conversans, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10999.2" n="II" level="1"> In medial form <orth extent="full" lang="la">conversor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (post-Aug.; a favorite word of Seneca; not in Quint.), </sense><sense id="n10999.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To abide, live</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dwell somewhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montibus (aquila),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10999.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To live with, have intercourse with, keep company with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 41:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 41, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:55:9" default="NO">55, 9</bibl> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">99, 21: inter humano sanguine delibutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 108, 4</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis a tenero asinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10999.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To live, pass one's life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 5, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 16, 9, § 3</bibl></cit> a.</sense></entryFree>
conversus: <entryFree id="n11000" type="main" key="conversus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of converro.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11001" type="main" key="conversus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of converto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11002" type="hapax" key="conversus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conversus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>converto</etym>, <sense id="n11002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twisting round</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convertibilis: <entryFree id="n11003" type="main" key="converti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convertĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">convers-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changeable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propositiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 33, 1</bibl></cit> and 2 (al. conversibilis): <cit><quote lang="la">deus convertibilis et demutabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 344</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vertĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., changeably</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Music. 5:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Music. 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
converto: <entryFree id="n11004" type="main" key="converto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n11004.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whirl round, to wheel about, to cause to turn, to turn back, reverse;</hi> and with the designation of the terminus in quem, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direct somewhere, to direct to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards, to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn to</hi>, etc. (very freq. in all perr. and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11004.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11004.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11004.3" n="a" level="4"> With a simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelos omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1097" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1097</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in infimo orbe luna convertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2</bibl>, <cb n="CONV" /> 39, 123; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minore sonitu quam putaram, orbis hic in re publicā est conversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddita inclusarum ex speluncā boum vox Herculem convertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter se convertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines calamistro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to curl</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11004.4" n="b" level="4"> With the designation of the terminus in quem. </sense><sense id="n11004.5" n="(a)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos frenis in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in eam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium ora atque oculos in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. under B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">iter in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in Phrygiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—Medial: <cit><quote lang="la">in fugam nemo convortitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit> Fleck.— </sense><sense id="n11004.6" n="(b)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc se confestim a Pulfione omnis multitudo convertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam materiam ad hostem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla ad freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum bis ad occasum, bis se convertit ad ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:386" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ad judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:157" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 157</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n11004.7" n="(g)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna contra vim atque impetum fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.8" n="(d)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum sub terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 654</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) By the <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus lumen in diem nobis luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 706</bibl></cit>.—Medial: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyro convertitur ales Itque super Libyen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 689</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) By local <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectum facile quo vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) By the <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">se domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11004.10" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>: convertere signa, aciem, etc., <hi rend="ital">to wheel about, change the direction of a march</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversa signa in hostes inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani conversa signa bipartito intulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos sese convertere cogunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to retreat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum conversis signis retro in urbem rediretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">convertunt inde signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 54, 10</bibl></cit> Drak. ad loc. (where Weissenb. ex conj., convellunt): <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:57:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 57, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aciem in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11004.11" n="b" level="4"> Rhet. t. t., of words, <hi rend="ital">to transpose, interchange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo mutare quaedam verba, sed extendere, corripere, convertere, dividere cogitur (poësis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11004.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab eo quod agitur avertat animos, ut saepe in hilaritatem risumve convertat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 138</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">risum in judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem orationem transduxi et converti in increpandam Caepionis fugam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem in fraudem malitiamque,</quote> <trans><tr>to employ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl> and 115: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium in injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos imperitorum ad deorum cultum a vitae pravitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 4</bibl> and 9: qui eas copias, quas diu simulatione rei publicae comparabant, subito ad patriae periculum converterunt, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13</bibl>, a, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem dicendi ad hominum perniciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium et studium ad causas agendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se aliquando ad timorem, numquam ad sanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad philosophos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque te animo et cogitatione converteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeum testimonii sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of turning to the political support of any one: <cit><quote lang="la">tota civitas se ad eos convertisse videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 4, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fama hujus rei convertit ad Masinissam Numidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 30, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass</hi>. in mid. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta ad victoris opes conversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to convert</hi> to Christianity, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad fidem Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Philem. 5, 10 sq.</bibl></cit>—Esp. freq. of turning or arresting the attention: <cit><quote lang="la">illud intellego, omnium ora in me convorsa esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">converterat Cn. Pompeii persona totum in se terrarum orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:31:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximas (provincias) in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4 al.</bibl></cit>: nihil opus est, ad continendas custodias plures commilitones converti, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 20</bibl> (31), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium oculos ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—And with inanimate things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliqua iis ampla et honesta res objecta totos ad se convertit et rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—Since the Aug. per. also freq. with a simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive elephas albus volgi converteret ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines quaqua iret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11004.14" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to change the nature of a thing;</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">to change, alter, transform, turn</hi>. <cb n="CONV" /> </sense><sense id="n11004.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With a simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Res ita convortant formas mutentque colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1005" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1005</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 678</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus induit ignotas hominum conversa figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanam vicem (venena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:88" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring into disorder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum avaritiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae viam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 166</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">conversi animum vultumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: castra castris, <hi rend="ital">to change camp with camp</hi> (i. e. to establish new camps by constantly removing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In gram.: casus conversi, = casus obliqui,</quote> <trans><tr>the cases which undergo a change of form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi si id putas, non posse jam ad salutem convorti hoc malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena omnis oculorum ad caecitatem mentis est conversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:40:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 40, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater magna, cujus ludi violati, polluti, paene ad caedem et ad funus civitatis conversi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad perniciem suam fuerat cogitatum, id ad salutem convertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si antequam tumor discutiatur in suppurationem convertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego me convortam in hirudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum sese in hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecubam in canem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras in freti formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum (sc. Jovem) in pretium (i. e. aurum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim morbi in quartanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen in laudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae se in graves inimicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11004.18" n="b" level="4"> Of written works, <hi rend="ital">to translate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">converti ex Atticis duorum eloquentissimorum nobilissimas orationes ... nec converti ut interpres, sed ut orator, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes e Graeco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua de Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum in Latinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 41, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.19" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to relurn</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n11004.20" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde (imago) retro rursum redit et convertit eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 334</bibl></cit> (Lachm. conj. convertitur): <cit><quote lang="la">clam cum paucis ad pedites convortit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regnum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convortit Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:645" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.21" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11004.22" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To return, turn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam atque in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sapientiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11004.23" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To change, turn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vitium huic uni in bonum convertebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 7, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium imperium in superbiam dominationemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 7</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ista vobis mansuetudo et misericordia ... in miseriam convortet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem, of political support,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convertor: <entryFree id="n11005" type="spur" key="convertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vertor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vortor</orth>, <itype>ti</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 480</bibl>, <sense id="n11005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form of converto; <cit><quote lang="la">only in the line: sed fugam in se tamen nemo convortitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; but the explanation is not satisfactory, and Fleck. reads: in fugam set tamen nemo convortitur, acc. to converto, I. A.; cf. Neue, Formenl. II. p. 330, and Ussing ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
convescor: <entryFree id="n11006" type="main" key="convescor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vescor</orth>, <itype>vesci</itype>, <sense id="n11006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to eat with one</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 18 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 18 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
convestio: <entryFree id="n11007" type="main" key="convesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype> (arch. <sense id="n11007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass</hi>. convestirier, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to clothe, cover with clothing</hi> (rare, and mostly in ante-class. poetry). *</sense><sense id="n11007.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cruenta corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11007.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: prata herbis, Poët. ap. Cic. Tusc. l. l.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Topiarium laudavi: ita omnia convestivit hederā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum lucis,</quote> <trans><tr>to surround</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:38:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 38, 101</bibl></cit>: omnia suā luce sol, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conveteranus: <entryFree id="n11008" type="main" key="conve^te^ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĕtĕrānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-veteran</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 65, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3580</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convexio: <entryFree id="n11009" type="main" key="convexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convexus</etym>, <sense id="n11009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vaulting, convexity</hi>, also <hi rend="ital">concavity</hi> (post-class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">convexitas): mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotunditatis solidae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convexitas: <entryFree id="n11010" type="main" key="convexi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convexĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vaulting, convex roundness, convexity, concavity</hi> (postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Plin. the elder): circuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava in caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 64, 64, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convexo: <entryFree id="n11011" type="main" key="convexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vexo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squeeze together</hi> (post-class., and perh. only in the foll. exs.): (multitudo) me male <pb n="465" /> <cb n="CONV" /> miseram convexavit, Soror Appii Caeci in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia cursu nimio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 65, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convexus: <entryFree id="n11012" type="main" key="convexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conveho</etym>, <sense id="n11012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vaulted, arched, rounded, convex, concave</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11012.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: convexum id est ex omni parte declinatum, qualis est natura caeli, quod ex omni parte ad terram versus declinatum est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 18</bibl> Müll. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Lucr., Quint., and Hor.): caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nutans convexo pondere mundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, mundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; Cic. Arat. ap. N. D. 2, 44, 112 Creuz. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 77, § 124</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sitting on the curved seats of the theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 6, 614</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11012.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">convexum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and more freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">convexa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a vault, arch, concavity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in convexo nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedet caeli convexa tueri,</quote> <trans><tr>the vaulted arch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 451</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vallium,</quote> <trans><tr>the hollows, cavities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum montibus umbrae lustrabunt convexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 608</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis sese halitus ... supera ad convexa ferebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 241</bibl></cit>; so of the heavens, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olyb. 242; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Rufin. 1, 367</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 454 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a theatre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Stil. 3, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11012.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <foreign lang="greek">*)enqu/mhma</foreign> crebrum et coruscum et convexum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 4</bibl> Hertz.—</sense><sense id="n11012.4" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">inclined, sloping downwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex ad aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 911</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 49, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis repente convexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11013" type="gloss" key="convexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">perife/reia</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</entryFree>
convibro: <entryFree id="n11014" type="main" key="convi_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vī^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n11014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n11014.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to move one's self rapidly</hi>: pedibus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11014.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to move a thing quickly, set in rapid motion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2</bibl></cit>, n. 12, p. 348, 40; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convicanus: <entryFree id="n11015" type="main" key="convi_ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vīcānus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">convīcānĕus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 11</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is of the same village, a fellow-villager</hi>, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. p. 436 Marin.; Cod. Th. 11, 24, 6, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
conviciator: <entryFree id="n11016" type="main" key="convi_ci^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīcĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">convīt-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>convicior</etym>, <sense id="n11016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a railer, reviler</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conviciolum: <entryFree id="n11017" type="hapax" key="convi_ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīcĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>convicium</etym>, <sense id="n11017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight reproach, a taunt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convicior: <entryFree id="n11018" type="main" key="convi_ci^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convīcĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">convīt-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n11018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to revile, reproach, taunt, rail at</hi> (rare; most freq. in Quint.; not in Cic.; cf., however, conviciator). </sense><sense id="n11018.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: cum alius eum salutasset, alius conviciatus esset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut accusare potius vere quam conviciari videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:78" default="NO">6, 3, 78</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n11018.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra dentientibus inhumane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:40" default="NO">5, 13, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 8, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convicium: <entryFree id="n11019" type="main" key="convi_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vīcĭum</orth> (less correctly, acc. to Brambach, <orth extent="full" lang="la">convītĭum</orth>, but preferred by B. and K., and by recent editors of Plaut. and Ter.), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>most prob. kindr. with vox; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 4</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 20</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n11019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud noise, a cry, clamor, outcry</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n11019.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne clamorem hic facias neu convitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erant autem convivia non illo silentio ... sed cum maximo clamore atque convitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">cantorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum, id. Fragm. ap. Aquil. Rom. p. 144 (187 Frotsch.): humanae linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 601</bibl></cit>.—Of frogs (with clamor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 12</bibl>. —Of the <hi rend="ital">cicadæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11019.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11019.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sound of wrangling, the cry of altercation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi et animus ex hoc forensi strepitu reficiatur et aures convitio defessae conquiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11019.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An urgent, clamorous importunity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam hanc convitio efflagitarunt codicilli tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 1</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 4:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11019.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A loud, violent disapprobation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contradiction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium vestrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl></cit>.— Most freq., </sense><sense id="n11019.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Loud, violent reproaching, abuse, reviling, insult</hi>: maledictio nihil habet propositi praeter contumeliam: quae si petulantius jactatur, convitium; si facetius<cb n="CONV" />  urbanitas nominatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl>: Pompeius apud populum ... cum pro Milone diceret, clamore convitioque jactatus est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, b, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei magnum convitium fieret cuncto a senatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui convitium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:25:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:16 al" default="NO">6, 2, 16 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 210</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11019.7" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <trans><tr>censure, reproof, correction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl></cit>: tacitum cogitationis, <hi rend="ital">in thought</hi>, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave ne eosdem illos libellos ... convicio scazontes extorqueant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11019.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11019.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The object of reproach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convitium tot me annos jam se pascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11019.10" n="B" level="2"> Of mockingbirds: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum convicia, picae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 676</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convictio: <entryFree id="n11020" type="main" key="convicti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convinco</etym>, <sense id="n11020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">demonstration, proof</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 13:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11021" type="main" key="convicti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convivo</etym>, <sense id="n11021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">companionship, intercourse, intimacy with one</hi> ( = 2. convictus): jucundissima, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11021.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = convictor: <cit><quote lang="la">convictiones domesticae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convictor: <entryFree id="n11022" type="main" key="convictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who lives with one, a table companion, messmate, familiar friend</hi>, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl>; id. Ira, 3, 8, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 14, 2</bibl>; Suet. Vit. Hor.</sense></entryFree>
convictus: <entryFree id="n11023" type="main" key="convictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from convinco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11024" type="main" key="convictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>convivo</etym>, <sense id="n11024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a living together, intimacy, social intercourse</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11024.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">societas, consuetudo): convictus humanus et societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; Lucceius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Helv. 15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Helv. 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:9 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 10, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11024.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a banquet, feast, entertainment</hi> (not anteAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 16, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 15</bibl>; 14, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 17:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:4 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
convinco: <entryFree id="n11025" type="main" key="convinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to overcome, conquer;</hi> always beyond the circle of milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n11025.1" n="I" level="1"> With personal objects, <hi rend="ital">to convict of crime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">error, refute</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11025.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego jam hic convincam palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus si causa non manifestissimis rebus teneretur, tamen eum mores ipsius ac vita convincerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum enim invenire volumus, non tamquam adversarium aliquem convincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristonis jam fracta et convicta secta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si negem, quo me teste convincas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11025.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With the designation of the crime, error, etc., commonly in the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, more rarely in the simple <case>abl.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">de, in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque in isto ipso convinco non inhumanitatis solum, sed etiam amentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duo levitatis et infirmitatis plerosque convincunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem summae neglegentiae (with coarguere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (supplicia) in convictos maleficii servos constituta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: latrocinii, caedis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifestis criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis avaritiae criminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicti et condemnati falsis de pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere convictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>; Lact. de Ira, 17, 6; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">istius vita tot vitiis flagitiisque convicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pari peccato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in homicidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in majore fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adfectatione imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid fecisse convinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convictus pecuniam cepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11025.4"
