G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: copiosissimus ac sollertissimus hostis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11086.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager silvestrium caprarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. 1. copis. —</sense><sense id="n11086.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: quamquam erat provincia minime copiosa ad alendos exercitus, Auct. B. Alex. 42.—</sense><sense id="n11086.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of an orator, or of discourse, <hi rend="ital">rich in language, copious in expression, eloquent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo copiosus ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua (opp. inops),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densior ille, hic copiosior in eloquendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa et varia et copiosa oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. jejunum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11086.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Existing in rich abundance, copious</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">liquor putei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varietas rerum abundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 28.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (very freq.), <hi rend="ital">in great abundance, copiously, abundantly, plentifully, copiously provided</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11086.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic copiose in provinciam profectus erat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large et copiose comparare pastum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepti tribus tricliniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatorum urna copiose absolvit,</quote> <trans><tr>by a large majority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11086.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of discourse, <hi rend="ital">copiously, fully, at length</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiose ab eo agri cultura laudatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiose et abundanter loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere causas reorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 28, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus tractatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copis: <entryFree id="n11087" type="main" key="co_pis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpis</orth> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 92</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n11087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>, more prob. than cops, assumed by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 752</bibl> P. The nominative in neither form is found in use), <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from coops; cf. inops</etym> (ante-class. for the class. copiosus), <hi rend="ital">abundantly supplied with something, abounding in, rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut amantem erilem copem facerem filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 117</bibl></cit>: aliquem copem causarum facere, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 22</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 61 Rib.); <cit><quote lang="la">Pac. ib. (Trag. Rel. v. 307 id.): copi pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. <cb n="COPU" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11088" type="greek" key="co^pis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kopi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 33</bibl> dub. (MSS. crepides).</sense></entryFree>
copla: <entryFree id="n11089" type="main" key="co_pla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōplātus</orth>, v. copula and copulatus.</entryFree>
copo: <entryFree id="n11090" type="main" key="co_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, = caupo, q. v.</entryFree>
copona: <entryFree id="n11091" type="main" key="co_po_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = caupona, q. v.</entryFree>
coponius: <entryFree id="n11092" type="main" key="Co_po_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōpōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plebeian family at Rome</hi>, e. g. the two brothers, T. and C. Coponii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 23, 53</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōpōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Coponius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 31, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coprea: <entryFree id="n11093" type="greek" key="copre^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coprĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kopri/as</foreign>, <sense id="n11093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low buffoon, a filthy jester</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 8</bibl>; cf. Dio Cass. 50, 28.</sense></entryFree>
cops: <entryFree id="n11094" type="main" key="cops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cops</orth>, <itype>cōpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 1. copis.</entryFree>
copta: <entryFree id="n11095" type="greek" key="copta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">copta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/pth</foreign>, <sense id="n11095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cake made of pounded materials</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:68" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 68</bibl>.— The same, or a similar kind, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">cop-tŏplăcenta</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40, 4</bibl>; Vesp. Judic. 46 (ap. Wernsd. Poët. Lat. Min. II. p. 234).</sense></entryFree>
coptatio: <entryFree id="n11096" type="main" key="copta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coptātio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">copto</orth>, v. coopt-.</entryFree>
coptoplacenta: <entryFree id="n11097" type="main" key="copto^pla^centa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coptŏplăcenta</orth>, v. copta.</entryFree>
coptos: <entryFree id="n11098" type="main" key="Copto^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coptŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kopto/s, *koptw/</foreign>, <sense id="n11098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trading town in the Thebaid, on the eastern side of the Nile</hi>, afterwards <hi rend="ital">Justinianopolis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Coft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 2</bibl>; Itin. Ant. p. 165, 6 al.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11098.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Coptis</orth>, <itype>tĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kopti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Coptos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11098.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Coptītēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kopti/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Coptos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomos,</quote> <trans><tr>that of which Coptos was the capital</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11098.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Coptītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Coptos</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adyta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copula: <entryFree id="n11099" type="main" key="co_pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (contr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpla</orth>, in Wernsd. Poët. Lat. Min. IV. p. 535), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coapio</etym>, <sense id="n11099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which binds together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">binds fast, a band, rope, thong, tie</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n11099.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tortae, <hi rend="ital">ship's rigging</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 200, 33</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 577 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copulā vinctum ante se Thynem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copula dura canem tenet,</quote> <trans><tr>a leash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 769</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 769</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora copulae sparteae triturā continuā exulcerati (muli),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 224 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of the <hi rend="ital">clasp</hi> of a bracelet, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Jun. 1, 8</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">grapnel-hooks</hi>, etc., by which vessels were held in battle: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem de causā minus commode copulis continebantur (naves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit> ex conj. (MSS. scopulis).—</sense><sense id="n11099.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bond, tie, connection;</hi> of love: <cit><quote lang="la">irrupta tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptialis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">copula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:26" default="NO">5, 4, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hymenaee), copula sacra deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 1</bibl></cit> Kopp ad loc.—Of friendship: <cit><quote lang="la">talium virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of words, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 17</bibl>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dignitas eloquendi copulationis ipsius decore servetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 509</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copulabilis: <entryFree id="n11100" type="main" key="co_pu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>copulo</etym>, <sense id="n11100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be connected</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Music. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Music. 4, 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
copulate: <entryFree id="n11101" type="main" key="co_pu^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. copulo, <sense id="n11101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
copulatim: <entryFree id="n11102" type="gloss" key="co_pu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>copulo</etym>, <sense id="n11102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in union</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 402</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
copulatio: <entryFree id="n11103" type="main" key="co_pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coupling, joining, connecting, uniting</hi> (several times in Cic. and Quint.). </sense><sense id="n11103.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">atomorum inter se (with complexiones and adhaesiones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copulatio rerum et coagmentatio naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11103.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of social union: <cit><quote lang="la">primi congressus copulationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of marriage, Cod. Th. 9, 42, 2.—Of words: ordo rerum, et copulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inoffensa vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 23 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum, verborum inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copulative: <entryFree id="n11104" type="main" key="co_pu^la_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. copulativus.</entryFree>
copulativus: <entryFree id="n11105" type="main" key="co_pu^la_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>copulo</etym>, <sense id="n11105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to connecting, copulative</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 286</bibl></cit>, and other gramm. —* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">connectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (diequinti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
copulator: <entryFree id="n11106" type="main" key="co_pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connecter, binder</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
copulatrix: <entryFree id="n11107" type="main" key="co_pu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>copulator</etym>, <sense id="n11107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who couples, connects</hi> (late Lat.): amorum, Auct. Perv. Ven. 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 11:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 11, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
copulatus: <entryFree id="n11108" type="main" key="co_pu^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from copulo. <pb n="468" /> <cb n="COQU" /></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11109" type="main" key="co_pu^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>copulo</etym> (only in <sense id="n11109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.), a connecting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joining together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationum consequentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
copulo: <entryFree id="n11110" type="main" key="co_pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n11110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, contr. cōplata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1088" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1088</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cō-pŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. I. A. b. infra), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>copula</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to couple, bind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tie together, to join, connect, unite</hi> (class.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n11110.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11110.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11110.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem cum beluā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 139 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput et corpus cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 130</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11110.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se quaedam possint coplata teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1088" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1088</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1078" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1078</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrimque Armeniae majori Sophene copulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput animalis ad pedem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 49, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversae insociabilesque arborum naturae copulantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 19, 30, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:43:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 43, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.7" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">adeunt, consistunt, copulantur dexteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit> Wagn. ad loc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 476, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">479, 24</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P., and Ussing ad loc. (others explain dexteras as <case>acc.</case> of the part, or Gr. <case>acc.</case>).—</sense><sense id="n11110.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to confront</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copulati in jus pervenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.9" n="2" level="3"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to associate with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave siris cum filiā meā copulari hanc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to join, connect, unite</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11110.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura cum praesentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestatem cum voluptate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestrem ordinem cum senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum inimico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah haec inter se jungi copularique possint?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51</bibl></cit>. 222.— </sense><sense id="n11110.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid naturae copulatum habuit Alcibiadis somnium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 69, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11110.14" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter copulando verba jungebant, ut sodes pro si audes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba copulata (opp. simplicia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constructio verborum tum conjunctionibus copuletur, tum dissolutionibus relaxetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">id. prooem. § 13: voluntates nostras,</quote> <trans><tr>to unite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit> pr.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 4, 6</bibl> pr.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copulari matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:32" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, taedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 493" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 493</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11110.15" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., joined together, united, connected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est animis admixtum, nihil concretum, nihil copulatum, nihil coagmentatum, nihil duplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: verba, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, II. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>.—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amabilius nec copulatius quam morum similitudo bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>.—‡ <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Inscr. de Lyon, p. 477, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">connectedly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">copulate dictum est (diequinti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:7" default="NO">17, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n11110.16" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a joint sentence</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sumpeplegme/non</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> conjunctum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
copulor: <entryFree id="n11111" type="hapax" key="co_pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, v. copulo, I. A. b.</entryFree>
coqua: <entryFree id="n11112" type="hapax" key="co^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coquus</etym>, <sense id="n11112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female cook</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coquibilis: <entryFree id="n11113" type="hapax" key="co^qui^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏcĭ-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coquo</etym>, <sense id="n11113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be easily cooked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coquina: <entryFree id="n11114" type="main" key="co^qui_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. coquinus.</entryFree>
coquinarius: <entryFree id="n11115" type="main" key="co^qui_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coquina</etym>, <sense id="n11115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the kitchen, culinary</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 140</bibl></cit>.—As the title of a work of Apicius, De arte coquinaria.— Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: culter, <hi rend="ital">a kitchen-knife</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coquinatorius: <entryFree id="n11116" type="main" key="co^qui_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīnātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏcī-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the kitchen</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">COCINATORIVM,</quote> <trans><tr>a kitchen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1359</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coquino: <entryFree id="n11117" type="main" key="co^qui_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>coquinus</etym>, <sense id="n11117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perform the office of a cook</hi>, perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl> Lorenz with MSS. (Fleck. in both passages coquitare, ex conj.; cf. coquito); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 3</bibl> Wagn., Ussing; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coquinus: <entryFree id="n11118" type="main" key="co^qui_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coquo</etym>, <sense id="n11118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to cooking</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit> and 2.—</sense><sense id="n11118.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n11118.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kitchen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 55, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11118.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The art of cooking, cookery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 17, 4</bibl> (al. coquinaria).</sense></entryFree>
coquitare: <entryFree id="n11119" type="main" key="co^qui^ta_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquĭtāre</orth>, used by Plaut. acc to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 18</bibl> Müll.: pro coctitare id est frequenter coquere: an tu coquitatum te ire <cb n="COQU" /> quoquam postulas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 64</bibl> Fleck.; 3, 2, 85; v. coquino.</entryFree>
coquitatio: <entryFree id="n11120" type="hapax" key="co^qui^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coquito</etym>, <sense id="n11120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a continuous cooking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coquo: <entryFree id="n11121" type="main" key="co^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. pak; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pep</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">pe/ptw</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">pe/ssw</foreign>; Germ. backen; Engl. bake</etym>, <sense id="n11121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cook, to prepare by cooking, to bake, boil, roast, parch, steep, melt, heat</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11121.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidie sic cena ei coquebatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1102</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 32, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 35, 13 al.: qui illa coxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae coxerat aere cavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce dedit, tostā quod coxerat ante polentā,</quote> <trans><tr>cooked from parched malt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pavonem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex oleo,</quote> <trans><tr>in oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 177</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 252" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 252</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nusquam coctum is, quidnam cenat Juppiter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nonum diem solet ire coctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquendo sit faxo et molendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11121.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n11121.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">coctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">cooked food</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, malum, curas, utrum crudum an coctum edim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit> Ussing: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid in popinas cocti praeter legumina aut olera veniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 16</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocta vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11121.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cocta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">water boiled, and cooled by ice; a decoction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:85:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 85, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11121.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11121.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prepare by fire, to burn, parch</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">laterculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 1</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">carbonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebas maturis solibus aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocta ligna,</quote> <trans><tr>dried, hardened by drying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:55:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 55, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coctus agger,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>built of bricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 11, 22: <cit><quote lang="la">rosaria cocta matutino Noto,</quote> <trans><tr>dried up, parched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 62; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at vos, praesentes Austri, coquite horum obsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum cum plumbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera fornacibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 405</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11121.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ripen, make mature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores sol ac luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:54:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 125</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis vindemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma (with matura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus solibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n11121.8" n="C" level="2"> = concoquo, <hi rend="ital">to digest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus confectus jam coctusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 54, 136</bibl> (but in these passages Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl>, would read concoquo, denying that coquo ever means <hi rend="ital">to digest;</hi> cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 16</bibl>); Lact. Opif. Dei, 14, 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">balineae ardentes, quibus persuasere in corporibus cibos coqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique ... bubulum coquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11121.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (in the poets and prose writers after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n11121.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To elaborate something in mind, to consider, to think, meditate upon, contrive, plan</hi>: quicquid est, incoctum non expromet; <cit><quote lang="la">bene coctum dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: bene cocto, condito, sermone bono, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia secreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trucem invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:300" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras cum fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:403" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latio extrema coepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:431" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 431</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11121.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To vex, harass, torment, disturb the mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet me coquo et macero et defetigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: si quid ego adjuero curamve levasso, quae nunc te coquit et versat in pectore fixa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si sollicitudo oratorem macerat et coquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ira metusque coquebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:103" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ... Femineae ardentem curaeque iraeque coquebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 345</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">cuocere;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">cuire.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">coctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to III. A. supra), <hi rend="ital">well considered, well digested</hi>: bene coctus sermo, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons: hodie juris coctiores non sunt, qui lites creant. Quam, etc. (alluding to the double meaning of jus), <hi rend="ital">better skilled in</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coquula: <entryFree id="n11122" type="main" key="co^quu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cocu-.</entryFree>
coquus: <entryFree id="n11123" type="main" key="co^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquus</orth> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquŏs</orth>; in many MSS. and inscrr. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook</hi> (very freq., esp. in Plaut., in whose comedies the cook takes a conspicuous place), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:220:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 220, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 4, 24</bibl> et saep.—In ancient times the cook baked also the bread; cf. Naev. ap. Paul. ex Fest. <cb n="CORA" /> p. 58, 14 Müll.—From the ancient writing, quoquus for cocus, originates the pun upon the <case>voc.</case> coque and quoque, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 47</bibl> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
cor: <entryFree id="n11124" type="main" key="cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor</orth> (ŏ, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 32</bibl>), cordis (<sense id="n11124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> cordium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 4, 4</bibl>, and 1 Cor. 4, 5; acc. to Fragm. Bob. Nom. et Pron. p. 132, also cordum, but without example), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. hrid; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kardi/a</foreign>; Germ. Herz; Engl. heart</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the heart</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n11124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the heart</hi>, as the chief source of the circulation of the blood, and so of life, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:37:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69</bibl>. §§ <cit><quote lang="la">181 and 182: cor tineosum, opinor, habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur censes, ullum animal, quod sanguinem habeat, sine corde esse posse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis globus aut oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 119</bibl></cit> et saep.— Also for the Greek <foreign lang="greek">kardi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the cardiac extremity of the stomach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11124.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto; cf. caput, II.), <hi rend="ital">a person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti juvenes, fortissima corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 87</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 864</bibl></cit>.—A term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 154</bibl> (cf. corculum).—</sense><sense id="n11124.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11124.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The heart</hi>, as the seat of feeling, emotion, etc., <hi rend="ital">heart, soul, feeling</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">videas corde amare inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>from the heart, cordially</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amare corde atque animo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus magnum timido cordi credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque meo Cordi quomquam esse cariorem hoc Phaedriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corde tremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura ex corde excessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor meum spes laudis percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:922" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 922</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectantis tangere querelā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeunt expleri corda tuendo Terribilis oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 265</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis acuere mortalia corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 330</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 302</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11124.5" n="b" level="4"> Cordi est alicui, <hi rend="ital">it lies at one's heart, it pleases, is pleasing, agreeable</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>: quod tibi magnopere cordi est, mihi vehementer displicet, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">89, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utut erga me est meritus, mihi cordi est tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque utriquest cordi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque eo mihi magis est cordi, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 14 al.</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinguere vestigia urbis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subigi nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11124.6" n="c" level="4"> Cordi habere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to have at heart, to lay great stress upon, to value</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:6" default="NO">17, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO">18, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11124.7" n="B" level="2"> Acc. to the ancients (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl>) as the seat of wisdom, understanding, <hi rend="ital">heart, mind, judgment</hi>, etc. (most freq. in ante-class. poets): quem (Hannibalem) esse meum cor Suasorem summum et studiosum robore belli, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl> (Ann. 374 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Ego atque in meo corde, si est quod mihi cor, Eam rem volutavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit> dub. (bracketed by Ritschl): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego nunc corde conspicio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam sapere corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1107" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim sequitur, ut cui cor sapiat, ei non sapiat palatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit> Madv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: cor Zenodoti, Fur. Bib. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cor Enni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>; cf., in a play on the meaning, I. A.: si pecudi cor defuisset, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cora: <entryFree id="n11125" type="greek" key="co^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rh</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott in h. v. III.), <sense id="n11125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pupil of the eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11126" type="main" key="Co^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/rh</foreign>, <sense id="n11126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of Proserpine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2361</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11127" type="main" key="Co^ra3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n11127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of Latium, in the territory of the Volsci</hi>, now the village <hi rend="ital">Cori</hi>, in the <hi rend="ital">Campagna di Roma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 392</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrāni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11127.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cora</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrăcēsĭ-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a town on the borders of Cilicia and Pamphylia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 4</bibl> and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the neighborhood of it is Mons Coracesius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coracesia: <entryFree id="n11128" type="main" key="co^ra^ce_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrăcēsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ko/rac</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magical herb said to make water freeze</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 99, § 156</bibl>. <pb n="469" /> <cb n="CORA" /></sense></entryFree>
coracicus: <entryFree id="n11129" type="gloss" key="co^ra^ci^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrăcĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ko/rac</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the raven;</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-răcĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. sacra), <hi rend="ital">the mysteries of Mithras</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coracino: <entryFree id="n11130" type="hapax" key="co^ra^ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrăcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to caw, croak</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kri/izein</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coracinus: <entryFree id="n11131" type="greek" key="co^ra^ci^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrăcĭnus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kora/ki=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n11131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raven-black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, coracinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:78:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 78, § 5</bibl> (al. croconum).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11132" type="greek" key="co^ra^ci_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrăcīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koraki=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n11132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of river fish</hi>, esp. in the Nile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 18, 32, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:85 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 85 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coralium: <entryFree id="n11133" type="greek" key="co_^ra_^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^rā^lĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cū^rā^lĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏral-lum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 110</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kora/llion</foreign>; Ion. <foreign lang="greek">koura/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n11133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coral</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">red coral</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 21 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 11</bibl></cit>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">21 and 22: coralium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 750</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 416</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>: coralia, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 169.—In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">corallius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 153</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coralli: <entryFree id="n11134" type="main" key="Co^ralli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏralli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lower Mœsia, on the Danube, on the coast of the Black Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 83</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrallĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Coralli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corallinus: <entryFree id="n11135" type="greek" key="co^ralli^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrallĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kora/llion</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coral-red</hi>: labra, Poëta in Anth. Lat. 1, p. 651 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
corallis: <entryFree id="n11136" type="greek" key="co^rallis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrallis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koralli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, unknown to us, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coralliticus: <entryFree id="n11137" type="main" key="co_^ralli_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^rallītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <sense id="n11137.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of white marble found in Asia Minor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coralloachates: <entryFree id="n11138" type="greek" key="co^rallo^a^cha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrallŏăchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koralloaxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n11138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coral-agate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corallum: <entryFree id="n11139" type="main" key="co^rallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. coralium.</entryFree>
coram: <entryFree id="n11140" type="main" key="co_ram"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōram</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>prob. kindred with ōs, ōris</etym>. <sense id="n11140.0" n="I" level="1"> Object., <hi rend="ital">in the presence of, before the eyes of, in the face of, before</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n11140.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor coram in os te laudare amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae tute dudum coram me incusaveras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram potius me praesente dixissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manlius quoque ad restituendam aciem se ipse coram offert,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>before the soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veni coram, singultim pauca locutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lenissimum genus admonitionis fuit traditio coram pugillarium,</quote> <trans><tr>in their presence, in their own hands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11140.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">coram noxae prehensus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the very act</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 226 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—So in coram with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> in App. = coram: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 21</bibl></cit> Oud.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>, p. 221, 17; 9, p. 223, 32; 10, p. 241, 5.—</sense><sense id="n11140.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with verbs of command, <hi rend="ital">in one's presence</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on the spot, forthwith</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly in Suet.): clipeos et imagines ejus coram detrahi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pinarium ... coram confodi imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedum ... redimi concidique coram imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit> (al. explain coram in all these passages as = coram omnibus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">publicly, openly;</hi> cf. palam).—Hence, coram deprehensus = <foreign lang="greek">e)p) au)tofw/rw|</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">in the very act</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 131, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11140.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prep</hi> with <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n11140.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Before the noun: <cit><quote lang="la">coram genero meo quae dicere ausus es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram frequentissimo legationum conventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram judicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram latrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:22 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 22 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11140.6" n="(b)" level="5"> After the noun (freq. in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipso Germanico coram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl>; 4, 8; 13, 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te coram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11140.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subject. adv., present in one's own person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">presence, personally</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia ted ipsus coram praesens praesentem videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istos rastros ... faoito coram ut tradas in manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me expurgem atque illum huc coram adducam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut si coram adesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem fere, quae ex nuntiis litteris cognoverat, coram perspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opp. letters,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 1, 2 al.</bibl>; cf. with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram me tecum eadem haec agere saepe conantem deterruit pudor, quae nunc expromam absens audacius,</quote> <trans><tr>by word of mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12</bibl></cit>. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">coram cernere letum nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod coram etiam ex ipso audiebamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem nec dare nec accipere nisi cum ipso coram duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 11, 1</bibl>; 43, 5, 6: rexque paterque Audisti coram, nec <cb n="CORC" /> verbo parcius absens, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 560</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
coramble: <entryFree id="n11141" type="greek" key="co^ramble_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏramblē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kora/mblh</foreign>, <sense id="n11141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cabbage injurious to the eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:178" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coranus: <entryFree id="n11142" type="main" key="Co^ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 3. Cora, II.</entryFree>
corax: <entryFree id="n11143" type="greek" key="co^rax1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rac</foreign>, <sense id="n11143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raven</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl>; ls<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11143.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a hooked engine of war, a battering-ram</hi> (called in pure Latin corvus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11144" type="main" key="Co^rax2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -acem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl>; <sense id="n11144.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">-aca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the most ancient Greek rhetorician in Sicily, a contemporary, perhaps also teacher, of Lysias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:8" default="NO">3, 1, 8</bibl>.—In a play upon words: <cit><quote lang="la">quare Coracem istum vestrum patiamur nos quidem pullos suos excludere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11145" type="main" key="Co^rax3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corbicula: <entryFree id="n11146" type="hapax" key="corbi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corbĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corbis</etym>, <sense id="n11146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little basket</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corbio: <entryFree id="n11147" type="main" key="Corbi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corbĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n11147.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc., a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensius Corbio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val.
