Max.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11147.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem., a town of the Æqui, in Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 28, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11147.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Spain, in the territory of the Suessetani, near the modern Berga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 42, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corbis: <entryFree id="n11148" type="main" key="corbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> regularly corbe: <sense id="n11148.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">corbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 136</bibl></cit> twice), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>corbes dicti quod curvatis virgis contexuntur, Isid. l. l.; but more prob. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ko/lpos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a basket</hi> (esp. for use in gathering fruits, etc.). </sense><sense id="n11148.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 5, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:99" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Dittoch. 147</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl> dub.—</sense><sense id="n11148.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 165</bibl>; cf. Caper de Verb. Dub. p. 2248; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl> (<case>abl.</case> corbe).—</sense><sense id="n11148.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Of dub. gender, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=139" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 139</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:52:2" default="NO">1, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 644</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corbitus: <entryFree id="n11149" type="main" key="corbi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corbītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corbis</etym>, <sense id="n11149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a scuttle, bower</hi>: navis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 533, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">corbīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slowsailing ship of burden</hi>: corbitae dicuntur naves onerariae, quod in malo earum summo pro signo corbes solerent suspendi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 7</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">corbita est genus navigii tardum et grande,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 533, 10</bibl></cit>; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. celox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on account of its slow motion: homines spissigradissimos, Tardiores quam corbitae sunt in tranquillo mari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corbona: <entryFree id="n11150" type="foreign" key="corbo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corbōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Syrian</etym>, <sense id="n11150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treasurechamber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 27, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corbula: <entryFree id="n11151" type="main" key="corbu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corbis</etym>, <sense id="n11151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little basket</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 4</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 197, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
corcholopis: <entryFree id="n11152" type="gloss" key="corcholopis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corcholopis</orth>, <sense id="n11152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ape having a tuft of hair at the end of its tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54</bibl> (where Lindem. reads cercolips, contr. to all MSS.; Müll. cercolopis).</sense></entryFree>
corchoros: <entryFree id="n11153" type="greek" key="corcho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corchŏros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-rus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rxoros</foreign>, <sense id="n11153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poor kind of pulse, growing wild</hi>: Corchorus olitorius, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 32, 106, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:144" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 92, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corcillum: <entryFree id="n11154" type="hapax" key="corcillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>corculum</etym>, <sense id="n11154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little heart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corcillum est quod homines facit, cetera quisquilia omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corcodilus: <entryFree id="n11155" type="main" key="corco^di_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corcŏdīlus</orth>, v. crocodilus.</entryFree>
corculum: <entryFree id="n11156" type="main" key="Corcu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cor</etym>, <sense id="n11156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 70</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a term of endearment,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">a surname of Scipio Nasica, on account of his sagacity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 44:6" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 44, 6</bibl>; and as <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corculi cognominati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 31, 31, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
corculus: <entryFree id="n11157" type="main" key="Corcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Corculum.</entryFree>
corcus: <entryFree id="n11158" type="main" key="corcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corcus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the chest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 21</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
corcyra: <entryFree id="n11159" type="main" key="Corcy_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corcȳra</orth> (y, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 663</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/rkura</foreign>. <sense id="n11159.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island in the Ionian Sea, opposite Epirus;</hi> in fable, <hi rend="ital">Scheria, the abode of Alcinous</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Corfu</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:4:12:19" default="NO">4, 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:52 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 52 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> and <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 16, 9, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 3 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11159.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corcȳ-raeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Corcyra, Corcyræan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <trans><tr>written in Corcyra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Alcinous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:37" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corcȳraei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Corcyra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 43, 10</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:508" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 508</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11159.2" n="II" level="1"> Corcyra Nigra <cb n="CORI" /> or Melaena, <foreign lang="greek">*ko/rkura *me/laina</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a small island in the Ionian Sea, on the coast of Illyr ia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Curzola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corda: <entryFree id="n11160" type="main" key="corda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corda</orth>, v. chorda.</entryFree>
cordate: <entryFree id="n11161" type="main" key="corda_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cordātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cordatus <sense id="n11161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cordatus: <entryFree id="n11162" type="main" key="corda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cordātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cor, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n11162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wise, prudent, judicious, sagacious</hi> (mostly anteand post-class.): egregie cordatus homo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 335 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 12:2, v. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 12, 2, v. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 34, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cordātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with prudence, wisely</hi> (with docte and cate), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cordax: <entryFree id="n11163" type="greek" key="cordax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cordax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rdac</foreign>, <sense id="n11163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extravagant dance of Grecian comedy, distinguished by lively movement and wanton gesture, and by the rope which was kept passing through the hands of the dancers;</hi> the imitation of this dance was regarded as a mark of drunkenness or licentiousness: ducere, <hi rend="ital">to dance it</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">ko/rdaka e(/lkein</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52, 9</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 34</bibl>).—Adject.: cordaces sententiae, i. e. tinnulae, <hi rend="ital">staggering</hi> (together with modulatae), Fronto de Or. 2, p. 240 Mai.— </sense><sense id="n11163.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of the trochaic rhythm, in a loose translation of Aristotle (<foreign lang="greek">o( de\ troxai=os kordakikw/teros</foreign>), on account of its hopping movement, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:193" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cordicitus: <entryFree id="n11164" type="hapax" key="cordi^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cordĭcĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cor</etym>, <sense id="n11164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from the heart, deep in the heart</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cordolium: <entryFree id="n11165" type="main" key="cordo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-dŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dolor</etym>, <sense id="n11165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sorrow at heart, grief</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 226, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corduba: <entryFree id="n11166" type="main" key="Cordu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cordŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kordu/bh</foreign>, <sense id="n11166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <hi rend="ital">on the river Bætis</hi>, now <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19 al.</bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cordŭbensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Corduba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 57.—Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cordŭ-benses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Corduba</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 59.</sense></entryFree>
corduena: <entryFree id="n11167" type="main" key="Cordu^e_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cordŭēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gorduhnh/</foreign>, <sense id="n11167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Greater Armenia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kurdistan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 20 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cordŭēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Corduena</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Kurds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 15, 17, § 44</bibl>; Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 20</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordyaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cordus: <entryFree id="n11168" type="main" key="cordus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cordus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. chordus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11169" type="main" key="Cordus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cordus</orth>, v. Cremutius.</entryFree>
cordyla: <entryFree id="n11170" type="greek" key="cordy_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cordȳla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kordu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n11170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fry of the tunny-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corfidius: <entryFree id="n11171" type="main" key="Corfi_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corfīdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 11, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corfinium: <entryFree id="n11172" type="main" key="Corfi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corfīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korfi/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n11172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very strongly fortified town of the Peligni, north of Sulmo</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pelino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:478 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 478 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11172.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n11172.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corfīnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Corfinium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exercised by Cæsar at this city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of occurrences there</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corfīnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Corfinium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11172.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corfīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Corfinium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 122" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 122</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
corgo: <entryFree id="n11173" type="gloss" key="corgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corgo</orth> <itype>apud antiquos pro adverbio, quod est profecto, ponebatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
coria: <entryFree id="n11174" type="main" key="Co^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of the fourth Minerva, among the Arcadians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coriaceus: <entryFree id="n11175" type="main" key="co^ri^a^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭăcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corium</etym>, <sense id="n11175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of leather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>made of leather</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coriaginosus: <entryFree id="n11176" type="main" key="co^ri^a_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭāgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coriago</etym>, <sense id="n11176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with the</hi> coriago (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Veg.): equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coriago: <entryFree id="n11177" type="main" key="co^ri^a_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corium</etym>, <sense id="n11177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the skin of animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 4, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coriandratum: <entryFree id="n11178" type="hapax" key="co^ri^andra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭandrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>coriandrum</etym>, <sense id="n11178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coriander-water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9:1:section=410" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 9, 1, § 410</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coriandrum: <entryFree id="n11179" type="greek" key="co^ri^andrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭandrum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-dron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">-drus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kori/annon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coriander</hi>: Coriandrum sativum, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:33:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:29" default="NO">11, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:117 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 35, § 117 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 103</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3:section=174 sq" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3, § 174 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coriarius: <entryFree id="n11180" type="main" key="co^ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corium</etym>, <sense id="n11180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to leather</hi> frutex, i. e. <hi rend="ital">useful for</hi> <pb n="470" /> <cb n="CORI" /> <hi rend="ital">tanning leather</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 54, § 91</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n11180.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tanner, currier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4074 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
corinna: <entryFree id="n11181" type="main" key="Co^rinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/pinna</foreign>. <sense id="n11181.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Greek poetess of Tanagra, contemporary with Pindar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:158" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 158</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11181.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A feigned name of the object of the poet Ovid's love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:73:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 73, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corinthia: <entryFree id="n11182" type="main" key="Co^rinthi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭa, Cŏrinthĭārĭus, Cŏ-rinthĭenses</orth>, etc., v. Corinthus, II.</entryFree>
corinthus: <entryFree id="n11183" type="main" key="Co^rinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Gr. Corinthos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 416</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Corinthon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:501" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 501</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:68" default="NO">10, 68</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n11183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. p. 30 Marin.: CORINTO DELETO), = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/rinqos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Corinth, a celebrated commercial city in the Peloponnesus, pillaged and destroyed by Mummius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the village Corinto</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Gereme;</hi> it was situated on the Isthmus (hence, bimaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 407</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:501" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 501</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">bimaris terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 282" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 282</bibl></cit>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 44</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:27 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 27 al.</bibl>—Prov. of an entrance into the harbor of Corinth, dangerous to ships: non cuivis homini contingit adire Corinthum (in acc. with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*ou) panto\s a)ndro\s e)s *ko/rinqon e)sq) o( plou=s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 36</bibl>; acc. to others this proverb is supposed to refer to the expense of living at Corinth.— </sense><sense id="n11183.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vessels made of Corinthian brass</hi> (cf. infra, II. A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">captivum portatur ebur, captiva Corinthus,</quote> <trans><tr>an entire Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 193</bibl></cit> (vasa Corinthia, ex aere Corinthio facta, Schol.).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11183.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11183.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Corinthian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11183.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager optimus et fructuosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Gulf of Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">isthmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 124" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Corinthian order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 56, § 178</bibl>; cf. O. Müll. Archaeol. §§ 53, 108, and 275.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Corinthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 3</bibl> et saep.; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 207</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11183.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: Corinthium aes, <hi rend="ital">an alloy of gold, silver, and copper, very much valued in antiquity, and much used for costly ornaments</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:16:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 16, 6</bibl> Duker.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis aere Corinthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 416</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">great wealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 5, 6.—Hence, vasa, <hi rend="ital">made of it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>, § 83; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vasa), <hi rend="ital">works of art made of it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11183.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n11183.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A worker in Corinthian brass;</hi> sarcast. appel. of Augustus, on account of his love of splendor, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11183.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An inspector of Corinthian vessels</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 639, 7 sq.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n11183.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Corinthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">10 and 11: Corinthiaci ponti litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 507</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11183.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Corinthian</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fons Pirene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrinthĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">colonists</hi>: Corinthienses ex eo dici coeperunt, ex quo coloni Corinthum sunt deducti, qui ante Corinthii sunt dicti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=60:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 60, 11</bibl> Müll. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
corioli: <entryFree id="n11184" type="main" key="Co^ri^o^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrĭŏli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kori/ola</foreign>, <sense id="n11184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Latium, destroyed by Caius Marcius</hi>, who, on account of this, received the surname <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrĭŏlānus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 5 sq.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrĭŏlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Corioli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corion: <entryFree id="n11185" type="greek" key="co^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n11185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> chamaepitys or hypericon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 53, § 85</bibl> (corissum, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
corippus: <entryFree id="n11186" type="main" key="Co^rippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; Flavius Cresconius, <sense id="n11186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Latin grammarian and poet, about the middle of the sixth century.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coris: <entryFree id="n11187" type="greek" key="co^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏris</orth>, <itype>is or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kori/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, a species of</hi> hypericon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 51, § 86</bibl>.— Also <hi rend="ital">the seed</hi> of it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 73, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corissum: <entryFree id="n11188" type="main" key="co^rissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the plant</hi> chamaepitys, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 53, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corium: <entryFree id="n11189" type="main" key="co^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=60:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 60, 7</bibl>; Sillig reads caros in both places; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 16</bibl>) [for <cb n="CORN" /> scorium, kindr. with scortum; Sanscr. kar; old Germ. sceran; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xo/rion</foreign>], <sense id="n11189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skin, hide, leather.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11189.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11189.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop., of animals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 84</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:935" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 935</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 19, § 63</bibl> et saep.: corium formā publicā percussum, of <hi rend="ital">the leather money of the Lacedæmonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 14, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11189.3" n="2" level="3"> Of human beings, only in comic or contemptuous sense: <cit><quote lang="la">Erus meus elephanti corio circumtentust, non suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. B. 3. infra. —</sense><sense id="n11189.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11189.5" n="1" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">rind, skin, bark, covering, shell</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11189.6" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">paper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11189.7" n="3" level="3"> Prov.: alicui corium concidere, <hi rend="ital">to curry his hide</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to beat him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 85</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fiet tibi puniceum corium, postea atrum denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercle detegetur corium de tergo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Varr. ap. Non. l. l.: satis facere alicui de corio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7, p. 53" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7, p. 53</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">petere corium,</quote> <trans><tr>to flog</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:24:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 24, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 14, 2</bibl>: canis a corio numquam absterrebitur uncto, i. e. <hi rend="ital">habits stick closely</hi>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xalepo\n xori/w| ku/na geu=sai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">it is bad to let the dog taste leather</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 83</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">de alieno corio ludere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at another's expense</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 193</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">corio suo ludere,</quote> <trans><tr>at one's own expense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11189.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11189.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A leather whip, thong</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">strap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11189.10" n="B" level="2"> In building, <hi rend="ital">the upper surface, a layer, stratum of earth, lime</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 47</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">the building</hi> of the bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 6, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cormasa: <entryFree id="n11190" type="main" key="Cormasa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cormasa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ku/rmasa</foreign>, <sense id="n11190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pisidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornelius: <entryFree id="n11191" type="main" key="Corne_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornēlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst., a designation of a Roman</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">celebrated as embracing the most distinguished Roman men and women</hi> (the patrician Scipios, Sulla, the Gracchi and their mother, etc.; the plebeian Balbi, Mammulae, Merulae, etc.).—Also <pos>adj.</pos>; hence the numerous laws made by the different Cornelii, but esp. by L. Cornelius Sulla, were called Leges Corneliae; cf. Ernest. and Orell. Clav. Cicer. in Ind. Legum, p. 13 sq.; Dict. of Antiq.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŏrum Cor-nēlĭum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a town of the Lingones in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11191.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornēlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Cornelius, Cornelian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>the oration of Cicero in defence of a certain C. Cornelius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:271" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">67, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70, 232</bibl>; its fragments, v. in Orell. IV. 2, pp. 446-454, and V. 2, pp. 56-81.—</sense><sense id="n11191.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornēlĭāna Castra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a place on the African coast, in the vicinity of Bagradas, named after the camp of the elder Scipio pitched there in the second Punic war</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ghellah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the same place was also called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castra Cornēlĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl>, §§ 24 and 29.</sense></entryFree>
corneolus: <entryFree id="n11192" type="main" key="corne^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. corneus]. </sense><sense id="n11192.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Horny, of horn</hi> (very rare): introitus (auris), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 146</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n11192.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hard, firm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornesco: <entryFree id="n11193" type="hapax" key="cornesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n11193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [cornu], <hi rend="ital">to become like horn, grow horny, turn to horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 261</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornetum: <entryFree id="n11194" type="main" key="corne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. cornus</etym>, <sense id="n11194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grove of cornel-trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=152" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 152</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 146.</sense></entryFree>
corneus: <entryFree id="n11195" type="main" key="corne^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornu</etym>. <sense id="n11195.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of horn, horny, horn-</hi> (rare but class.): corneo proceroque rostro (ibes), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:697" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:61" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 32, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungula (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta Somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 894</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:288" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 288</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11195.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hard as horn, horny</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora piscatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 19, 18, § 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11195.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibra,</quote> <trans><tr>hard-heartedness, insensibility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11195.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of korn</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cereum aut corneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 8, 12, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 894</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11196" type="main" key="corne^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. cornus</etym>, <sense id="n11196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the cornel-tree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cornelwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: clavi, Cato, <cb n="CORN" /> R. R. 18, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">hastilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cornicen: <entryFree id="n11197" type="main" key="corni^cen1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭcen</orth>, <itype>cĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cornu-cano; cf.: tibicen, tubicen, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n11197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a horn-blower, corneter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:34 al" default="NO">3, 34 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11198" type="main" key="Corni^cen2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of several persons in the</hi> gens Oppia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 11 al.</bibl>; also in the access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭ-cĭnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornicor: <entryFree id="n11199" type="main" key="corni_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornīcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>cornix</etym>, <sense id="n11199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to caw like a crow</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid grave secum inepte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 828</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 125</bibl>, n. 16.</sense></entryFree>
cornicula: <entryFree id="n11200" type="hapax" key="corni_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little crow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corniculans: <entryFree id="n11201" type="main" key="corni^cu^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭcŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. corniculum</etym>, <sense id="n11201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horn-shaped, horned</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the new moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 1</bibl>; cf. corniculatus.</sense></entryFree>
corniculanus: <entryFree id="n11202" type="main" key="Corni^cu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭcŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Corniculum, B.</entryFree>
cornicularia: <entryFree id="n11203" type="main" key="Corni^cu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭcŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lost play of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cornicularius: <entryFree id="n11204" type="main" key="corni^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. corniculum</etym>. <sense id="n11204.0" n="I" level="1"> In milit. lang. (prop. one who had been presented with a corniculum, and thereby promoted), <hi rend="ital">an adjutant of a centurion, tribune, proprætor</hi>, etc. (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:14:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:1:28:section=71 al" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 28, § 71 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11204.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to civil offices, <hi rend="ital">an assistant, aid, secretary</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 15, 11; 7, 4, 32; 8, 4, 10; Firm. Math. 3, 6.</sense></entryFree>
corniculatus: <entryFree id="n11205" type="hapax" key="corni^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a horn, horned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the new moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. corniculans.</sense></entryFree>
corniculum: <entryFree id="n11206" type="main" key="corni^cu^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n11206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little horn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11206.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 28, 34, § 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11206.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11206.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small tunnel of horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 15</bibl> and 20.—</sense><sense id="n11206.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A horn-shaped ornament upon the helmet, as a reward for bravery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:723" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> 723</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11207" type="main" key="Corni^cu^lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11207.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭcŭlā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Corniculum;</hi> so the father of Servius Tullius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 7" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and his mother,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:628" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 628</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corniculus: <entryFree id="n11208" type="main" key="corni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. corniculum</etym>, <sense id="n11208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the civil office of a</hi> cornicularius, Cod. Th. 1, 15, 11; 8, 7, 8.</sense></entryFree>
cornifer: <entryFree id="n11209" type="main" key="corni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <sense id="n11209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bearing horns, horned</hi> (for the usu. corniger): cervi, Poët. ap. Mai, Auct. Class. 5, p. 456.</sense></entryFree>
cornificius: <entryFree id="n11210" type="main" key="Corni^fi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornĭfĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman plebeian</hi> gens; so, </sense><sense id="n11210.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Cornificius, friend of Cicero and author of rhet. and gram. works, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:21 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 21 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11210.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Latin poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:436" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 436</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>; cf. Don. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornifrons: <entryFree id="n11211" type="hapax" key="corni^frons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭ-frons</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n11211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with horns on the forehead</hi>: armentae, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 190, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corniger: <entryFree id="n11212" type="main" key="corni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornugero</etym>, <sense id="n11212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bearing horns, horned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 751</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 701</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 368</bibl></cit>: Taurus, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 110; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 511</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:926" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 926</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ammon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; 15, 309; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:201" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius Hesperidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Numicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 15, 17</bibl></cit>; v. Bacchus, I.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭgĕra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animalia), <hi rend="ital">horned animals, horned cattle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 85, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl> sq. al.; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ cornĭgĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. cerva), <hi rend="ital">a hind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1463</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cornipes: <entryFree id="n11213" type="main" key="corni^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cornu</etym>, <sense id="n11213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hornfooted, hoofed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Faunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:361" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planta (Panis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:338" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 338</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cornĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (so most freq. in Claud.), <hi rend="ital">a horn-footed animal;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">the horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:361" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 361</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:684" default="NO">7, 684</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Fesc. 11, 11 al.</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the centaur Chiron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 180</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
corniscarum: <entryFree id="n11214" type="gloss" key="Cornisca_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corniscārum</orth> <itype>divarum locus erat trans Tiberim cornicibus dicatus, quod in Junonis tutelā esse putabantur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 7</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 88, 14</bibl>.</entryFree>
cornix: <entryFree id="n11215" type="main" key="cornix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with corvus <pb n="471" /> <cb n="CORN" /> and <foreign lang="greek">korw/nh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1083</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 14, § 30 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">renowned as being long lived,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1083</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 153</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">its appearance on the left side was considered as a favorable omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and its cries as a sign of rain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 388</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 13</bibl>.—Its eyes were used as a charm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 16 Paley ad loc.—From its custom of attacking its prey first in the eyes is taken the proverb: cornicum oculos configere, <hi rend="ital">to delude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deceive the most wary</hi> (Anglice, <hi rend="ital">to catch a weasel asleep</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl> (cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 22</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">and ellipt.: cornici oculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Fl. 20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl></cit> (cf. Schol. Bobiens. V. 2, p. 242 Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
cornu: <entryFree id="n11216" type="main" key="cornu_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cornū</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 68</bibl> Dint.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:11 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 11 al.</bibl>; ū in the connection cornu bubuli and cornu cervini; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:5:76" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 5, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 20, 1 al.</bibl>; cf. esp. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 355), <gen>n.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cornum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 5</bibl> Fleck.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:874" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 874</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 141" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:2 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 2 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n11216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> cornorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 60" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 60</bibl>. —An access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cornus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, has been assumed on account of the <hi rend="ital">rel. masc.</hi> in the passage: <cit><quote lang="la">nares similes cornibus iis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>, if the reading is correct.—The <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> apparently never used; <cit><quote lang="la">for in the connection: laevo cornu Cotys rex praeerat ... dextro cornu praepositus C. Licinius Crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58, 6</bibl></cit> and 7, the supposition of the <case>abl.</case> is more in acc. with the usage of Livy; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Antipatrum in laevo praeposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 41, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.) [kindred with <foreign lang="greek">ke/ras</foreign>, and Germ. and Engl. horn; cf. also carina, cervus], <hi rend="ital">a horn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11216.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hard and</hi> generally <hi rend="ital">crooked growth upon the head of many mammiferous animals</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:123 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 123 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a bullock,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1033</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1324" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 58</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">also of the constellation Taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the ram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 328</bibl></cit>; and the constellation Aries, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 111; <cit><quote lang="la">of the he-goat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of kids,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:526 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 526 al.</bibl></cit>—Of <hi rend="ital">the antlers of a stag</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:725 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 725 al.</bibl>: Cornu Copiae (less correctly, but freq. in late Lat., as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornūcōpĭae</orth>, and twice <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cornūcōpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 2, 3</bibl>), acc. to the fable, <hi rend="ital">the horn of the goat Amalthea placed in heaven</hi>, Greek <foreign lang="greek">*ke/ras *)amalqei/as</foreign> (v. Amalthea), <hi rend="ital">the emblem of fruitfulness and abundance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">things similar to horn in substance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">made of horn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11216.3" n="1" level="3"> That which is similar to horn in substance. </sense><sense id="n11216.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A hoof</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:327" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 327</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.5" n="b" level="4"> Of <hi rend="ital">the bills of birds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 502</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The horny skin covering the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.7" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A horny excrescence on the head, a wart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 58</bibl>.— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n11216.8" n="2" level="3"> That which is similar to a horn in form, <hi rend="ital">a projecting extremity, the point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">end</hi> of any object. </sense><sense id="n11216.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The tooth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tusk of an elephant, ivory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 39</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu Indicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:73:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 73, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The horns of the moon</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 122, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 117</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11216.11" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The branches of a river</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 774</bibl>.—Hence, the river-gods were represented with horns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 371</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 7</bibl> et saep.; cf.: corniger, tauriformis, etc., and v. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">ke/ras</foreign>, V.—</sense><sense id="n11216.12" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The arm of the shore forming a harbor, a tongue of land</hi>, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 410</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.13" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The extremity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">end of the sailyards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 549</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 832</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14</bibl>. 389.—</sense><sense id="n11216.14" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The cone of a helmet in which the crest was placed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum cornu galeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11216.15" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The end of the stick around which books were rolled, usually ornamented with ivory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:107" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 107</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11216.16" n="h" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The side of a bow in the form of a</hi> <cb n="CORN" /> <hi rend="ital">horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 455</bibl>;
